text: It seems like Tyler Perry is trying very hard to make a crossover movie. It looks as though he's trying to win the support of the critics, while, at the same time leaving his original fan base in the dust. My conjecture is that he's doing this either because his movie sales are waning or because LG is pressuring him to do so. I, however, think it's the former because although his movies are still doing well, they aren't debuting at the #1 spot they always has.       Nevertheless, this movie looks good, but I don't get the excitement, seeing his trailers, I use to get from his earlier movies; I'll pass until the DVD release. Hopefully, by then, Tyler will bring back the kind of drama that made him famous.
author: David Oliver

author: Bajan1

text: I saw another thread on facebook where comments automatically bashed and made comments like "smh" and speaking against the movie as if it is wrong to celebrate "single motherhood". I don't believe single motherhood is the ideal situation and as a single mother, I would never promote this type of lifestyle. It is hard as heyell shouldering all of the responsibilities alone. However, I can't understand for the life of me how some people seem to harp on or go into full attack at the very mention of celebrating a single mom. It almost sounds like hatred to me. What kills me is no one has actually seen the movie yet and when I saw the trailer, I didn't see anything problematic except for the fat black funny woman stereotype. All those that want to preach that single mother status is not ideal and shouldn't be celebratory, we get it...however, I disagree that mothers like me should crawl into a hole never to be heard from again and act as if we don't have a story to tell just like everyone else. Grant it, Tyler Perry is not the ideal person I would want to tell the story...but at least he is out there trying to tell someone's story. I don't get the full attack on Tyler Perry either. No, I'm not a huge fan, but I don't get why he has become a target when I see so many other writers and directors making equally offensive movies towards black women. The only hang up with Tyler Perry is his movies are poorly made and poorly directed as  well as the actors and actresses seem to lose all acting abilities in his films.

text: I'm not sure how this movie is offensive at all.  I'm not a single mom , but I knew some single mom's.  I can only imagine what it can be like to raise a child by yourself.  It's hard raising kids period.  But if I was a single mom it would be nice to be able to have or go to a club just for single moms or even single dads.  Even though I'm not a single mother, I wanted to join a club where I can meet other mothers and their kids for my child to play with and I did just that, so why is it hard to believe that a single mom can go to a single mom's club?  When I first saw this preview I knew I had to go see it and I am going to see it as soon as it comes out.  I think it's funny and a great movie to watch.  There are single mothers that do date.  Why is that so hard to believe?  If you are so busy that you can't make time for yourself then well you need to.  There is nothing wrong with taking time for yourself.  My husband and I do it all the time, but we make sure that we spend as much time as possible with our kids.  If my husband and I can go out on a date a single mom can find a man for herself.  I don't know Tyler Perry personally, but what ever type of person he is who cares.  If the movie is a good movie and it's funny then that is all that matters.  You don't have to like Tyler Perry as a person, but if his movies are good then that is what matters.  I thought the preview was funny and I think it would be a great movie to see.

text: For some people this movie may look cheessy and stupid and boring but let me tell u being a single Mother is freaken hard is not easy it requires a lot of effort caring and responsibility u have to work pay bills cook clean and wash dishes wash clothes help the kids with homework the Dads do the easy part pick up the kids every other weekend and do just the fun things and by the way a lot of women aren't single mothers cause they want to a lot of times is cause they have been abused by they're husbands or they had cheated on them centuries ago it was ok on society for women to get cheated on or abused we are not on those times anymore thanks God and that's why there's more divorces now cause women don't put with abuse anymore so excuse me if I'm being too bold but is the truth either people like it or not

text: Some people JUST. DON'T. GET. IT.  This is not about me. This is not about Tyler Perry's fans. This is not about Tyler Perry himself.  It's about YOUNG GIRLS.  Our young ladies 14-21 years old need to know that single motherhood is NOT OK and is NOT something to be celebrated. I don't care how hard of a life single moms have.  These girls need to learn to keep their legs closed, or if they just can't resist the urges, then there are 15+ forms of birth control.  And for the women who say they are a single mom by choice (WTF?), the young girls need to know the pros and cons of both situations, which then they would clearly see that a TWO PARENT HOUSEHOLD is by far the better option.  And please spare me the "what if her husband dies" crap. No one can predict death. And this is still not a situation to be admired - it's tragic and unfortunate, that's it.  In this order:  1. Abstinence. if that doesn't work for her, then 2. Birth control. If the idiot boyfriend doesn't want to wear a condom then tell him to get the hell out of your face. 3. A two parent family. And if that can't happen, then 4. Good co-parenting with constant communication between the parents.  Anything else is lunacy.  But alas, I bet some of you women are going to have your daughters right up in the theaters with you to see you get pimp slapped by Perry....

text: I'll be honest Tyler Perry does not have a clean insight to the lives of minority women, in particular black women at all.  The one lady in this trailer, the loud mouth black woman, is so absurd!  These types of cheap jokes only perpetuates stereotypes of black women as loud mouthed and classless.  The "oh no you didn't." The "Oh girlfriend." The one frying chicken in pan full of fat, yes that stereotype.  Ask yourself, how many black women do you know speak in such a manner?  Movies like this gives non-black people cause to say things such as, "hey girlfriend" to a black woman that they don't know (which by the way happened to me).  I personally do not speak this way and it's really confusing to me how perfect strangers think that it is okay to address another person with "hey girlfriend."  Unfortunately, people make assumptions and this movie progresses the wrong assumptions.   At this point in society, it's really annoying and I am offended as a Black Woman.  Needless to say, I wont be seeing this.  I would rather watch smart movies like 12 Years a Slave and see black people who speak properly versus this mockery.

text: Tyler Perry isn't despicable just because he keeps producing crap films. Rather, Perry is despicable because he has the power and connections to produce real art, collaborate with creative minds, and actually surprise us for once. But, instead, continually opts to inject stupidity into the public because it's an easy way to make a quick buck, and then actually has the nerve to defend himself as an artist. Mr. Perry, you are truly an American villain.
